Package org.radarbase.auth.token

Interface RadarToken

All Known Implementing Classes:

Created by dverbeec on 10/01/2018.

  • Method Details

    • getRoles

      Set<AuthorityReference> getRoles()
      Get all roles defined in this token.
      Returns:
      non-null set describing the roles defined in this token.

    • getAuthorityReferencesWithPermission

      default Stream<AuthorityReference> getAuthorityReferencesWithPermission(RoleAuthority.Scope scope, Permission permission)

    • getReferentsWithPermission

      default Stream<String> getReferentsWithPermission(RoleAuthority.Scope scope, Permission permission)
      Get the referents (i.e., organization or project name) in a given scope that matches a permission.
      Parameters:
      scope - scope of the referents
      permission - permission that should be authorized within the scope
      Returns:
      referents names

    • hasGlobalAuthorityForPermission

      default boolean hasGlobalAuthorityForPermission(Permission permission)
      Check if any non-project related authority has the given permission. Currently the only non-project authority is SYS_ADMIN, so we only check for that.
      Parameters:
      permission - the permission
      Returns:
      true if any non-project related authority has the permission, false otherwise

    • getAuthorities

      List<String> getAuthorities()
      Get a list of non-project related authorities.
      Returns:
      non-null list of authority names

    • getRoleAuthorities

      default Set<RoleAuthority> getRoleAuthorities()
      Get a list of non-project related authorities.
      Returns:
      non-null list of authority names

      List<String> getScopes()
      Get a list of scopes assigned to this token.
      Returns:
      non-null list of scope names

      List<String> getSources()
      Get a list of source names associated with this token.
      Returns:
      non-null list of source names

      List<String> getAudience()
      Get the audience of the token.
      Returns:
      non-null list of resources that are allowed to accept the token

      Get the token type.
      Returns:

    • getClientId

      String getClientId()
      Client that the token is associated to.
      Returns:
      client ID if set or null if unknown.

    • getClaimString

      String getClaimString(String name)
      Get a token claim by name.
      Parameters:
      name - claim name.
      Returns:
      a claim value or null if none was found or the type was not a string.

    • getClaimList

      List<String> getClaimList(String name)
      Get a token claim list by name.
      Parameters:
      name - claim name.
      Returns:
      a claim list of values or null if none was found or the type was not a string.

    • hasAuthority

      boolean hasAuthority(RoleAuthority authority)
      Check if this token gives the given permission, not taking into account project affiliations.

      This token must have the authority in its set of authorities. If it's a client credentials token, this is the only requirement, as a client credentials token is linked to an OAuth client and not to a user in the system.

      Parameters:
      authority - The permission to check
      Returns:
      true if this token has the permission, false otherwise

    • hasPermission

      boolean hasPermission(Permission permission)
      Check if this token gives the given permission, not taking into account project affiliations.

      This token must have the permission in its set of scopes. If it's a client credentials token, this is the only requirement, as a client credentials token is linked to an OAuth client and not to a user in the system. If it's not a client credentials token, this also checks to see if the user has a role with the specified permission.

      Parameters:
      permission - The permission to check
      Returns:
      true if this token has the permission, false otherwise

    • hasGlobalPermission

      boolean hasGlobalPermission(Permission permission)
      Check if this token gives the given permission from a global scope.

      This token must have the permission in its set of scopes. If it's a client credentials token, this is the only requirement, as a client credentials token is linked to an OAuth client and not to a user in the system. If it's not a client credentials token, this also checks to see if the user has a global role with the specified permission.

      Parameters:
      permission - The permission to check
      Returns:
      true if this token has the permission, false otherwise

    • hasPermissionOnOrganization

      boolean hasPermissionOnOrganization(Permission permission, String organization)
      Check if this token gives a permission in a specific organization.
      Parameters:
      permission - the permission
      organization - the organization name
      Returns:
      true if this token has the permission in the project, false otherwise

    • hasPermissionOnOrganizationAndProject

      boolean hasPermissionOnOrganizationAndProject(Permission permission, String organization, String projectName)
      Check if this token gives a permission in a specific project in a given organization.
      Parameters:
      permission - the permission
      organization - the organization name
      projectName - the project name
      Returns:
      true if this token has the permission in the project, false otherwise

    • hasPermissionOnProject

      boolean hasPermissionOnProject(Permission permission, String projectName)
      Check if this token gives a permission in a specific project.
      Parameters:
      permission - the permission
      projectName - the project name
      Returns:
      true if this token has the permission in the project, false otherwise

    • hasPermissionOnSubject

      boolean hasPermissionOnSubject(Permission permission, String projectName, String subjectName)
      Check if this token gives a permission on a subject in a given project.
      Parameters:
      permission - the permission
      projectName - the project name
      subjectName - the subject name
      Returns:
      true if this token ahs the permission for the subject in the given project, false otherwise

    • hasPermissionOnSource

      boolean hasPermissionOnSource(Permission permission, String projectName, String subjectName, String sourceId)
      Check if this token gives a permission on a given source.
      Parameters:
      permission - the permission
      projectName - the project name
      subjectName - the subject name
      sourceId - the source ID
      Returns:
      true if this token gives permission for the source, false otherwise

    • isClientCredentials

      boolean isClientCredentials()
      Whether the current credentials were obtained with a OAuth 2.0 client credentials flow.
      Returns:
      true if the client credentials flow was certainly used, false otherwise.
